title.narrative: Evaluation on forced displacement and Finnish development policy

description.narrative: Finlands development policy 2016 puts emphasis on the effect of refugee flows and increased migration on development policy. Four pathways are included in the development policy: 1) humanitarian aid and development cooperation 2) policy influencing in the European Union (EU) and international organizations and for a 3) policy coherence for development and 4) benefits to host countrys development.Policy Coherence for Development (PCD) has been one of key principles of Finlands development policy for a long t ime which is also clear in the latest development policy programmes of 2012 and 2016. In the programme of 2012 the support to PCD and its implementation was committed. The programme of 2016 confirms that Finland will pursue its development policy coherentl y to ensure that the individual policy goals listed in the Government Programme support the achievement of sustainable development. The evaluation will assess how the objectives of development policy relating to refugees have been supported through humanit arian aid development cooperation policy influencing and policy coherence for development. The evaluation approach will be participatory and emphasize learning of the MFA staff and partners from the past and developing the good practices for the future.The time scope will be from 2012 to mid 2018. The evaluation will cover bilateral and multilateral cooperation international and Finnish non-governmental organizations and humanitarian assistance.The evaluation results will be used to enhance future developme nt policy and cooperation by e.g. informing the next development policy programme and financial decisions in future.
